name: Maxwell
title: It looks pretty, but the space bar is trash.
reviews: I purchased this keyboard for my at home office setup. I have an older 4+ year old mechanical keyboard that I took back to my office now that work from home has ended for me. Would that I could have purchased a second of that 4+ year old mechanical keyboard. It worked like a charm. This one just does not.

name: James
title: Decent for the price with one annoying feature
reviews: It's my first mechanical keyboard and I'm generally happy with it, especially for the price as compared to more expensive ones. But it does have a tendency to double-tap letters sometimes, requiring me to go back and delete the duplicate letter. This doesn't happen often enough to significantly impair the usefulness of the keyboard, but it's annoying when it does happen.

name: Pen Name
title: Great deal!
reviews: A little disappointed in how loud the buttons are but other than that I'm happy

name: Shyanne Baker
title: Am i the only one having this issue?
reviews: I do enjoy this- ive noticed certain keys will just randomly not work. I play a decent amount of games that use W A S D and QWER and ive noticed some times i cant press them rapidly and sometimes they will not work or register that they are being pressed. Other than that i like it

name: Angel Martínez
title: Teclado
reviews: Muy buen producto llego en perfectas condiciones.

name: Fox Mulder
title: lasted 7 months
reviews: purchased in July 2021. easy setup just plug and play. looks nice and seems well made, however it is now Feb 2022 and some of the keys are not working correctly. Space bar is page down and so are a few of the letter keys. Will look for another brand for replacement since return window has passed.

name: AC
title: Very nice
reviews: Very nice, first mechanical keyboard. Very loud clicky clack key noise. Wife thought I was using a type writer!

name: paladin
title: Great eye candy
reviews: The colors are great. You can change lighting designs and motion.

name: Lisa Sorenson
title: Keyboard was shipped with no packing or foam. I should have sent it back.
reviews: Keys sticking

name: Amazon Customer
title: Terrible keyboard - do not buy
reviews: Just a few weeks after I got it, the space bar started working only like half the time. now the E key has stopped working almost completely as well. People buy a mechanical keyboard to avoid these types of issues, and this keyboard has been nothing but trouble.

name: Lizanne Michael
title: Game mouse using for office work
reviews: I really like this gaming mouse because of the colors it’s got like a really cool set of colors that it changes to. I also like that it’s not like a plastic tail. It’s a little difficult to handle, it’s kind of slow, but I guess that’s what you get with this gaming mouse. I do use it for work and it’s fine. I intentionally purchased it to use for work.

name: Phaser
title: Nice, but heavy
reviews: Overall a great product. The only reason why I'm giving it four stars instead of five is the weight. As a gamer, this mouse was more bulky and heavier than I originally thought it would be. The main thing about the product is also the lighting. It's cool and all, but I would prefer it so I can change the color to what I want without it being a specific DPI. If you're using this as an everyday mouse, great purchase. If you're using this for gaming, it's still a great mouse. It's cheap, and actually nice. These are just my opinions, but I'm sure you'd love the mouse.

name: D. Mathis
title: Fiodio Wired Gaming Mouse has great feel
reviews: Fiodio Wired Gaming Mouse I use mostly for laptop has good result for ergonomics and has a decent price.

name: Casey Martinez
title: Not for big hands
reviews: My thumb is always touching the extra 2 thumb buttons which doesn't feel good. If you have a large hand that could be an issue for long term use. Everything else is good.

name: Aaron
title: Comfortable and Large; but not Silent
reviews: Very comfortable for my hand and also has almost a minky-soft feel to the plastic. Programmable buttons work great, it's a very good size, and it cycles through colors nicely. Only problem is that it is about the same volume as a regular computer mouse click despite being advertised as silent; no problem for me though. Also you may have to uninstall and reinstall the device to avoid mouse lag when you first get it but it only takes a couple minutes and for a guide on win10 I used  ComputerSluggish Tutorial's video on it. Overall very good for price. Will update if something goes wrong.

name: Skytan
title: ok
reviews: it's ok

name: briana weekly
title: The scroll wheel…
reviews: It’s a good mouse for the money but the scroll wheel is recessed into the body and makes it hard to use.

name: Lillian Vargas
title: Love the colors
reviews: I love the colors on this mouse. It's very nice to look at. It's very responsive too, however, it's a little too large for the size of my hands. I have to stretch to reach the scrolling wheel.

name: Gabriel Canuteson
title: Slow, not Good for gaming.
reviews: The mouse is comfortable and can support a large hand but the response time is less than ideal and it feels very sluggish.

name: Whom ever this may be
title: Maybe
reviews: 3/5 wouldn’t try again, nothing special.

name: Wilson
title: No serve después de un mes. Not working anymore.
reviews: It stopped working after a month! Don’t buy.

name: Aaron T.
title: Not durable
reviews: Was great for a couple of months. Then the T key started stittttctktittngt.

name: Karen
title: Gaming Keyboard
reviews: A nice gaming keyboard, but not as comfortable for typing.

name: J. Rose
title: Very clicky!
reviews: I mostly wanted this keyboard because I adore the loud, clicky sound of mechanical keyboards. As a child of the 80s, I learned how to type on a wonderful, clunky Packard Bell keyboard and it was amazing. All the keyboards I've had since have been thin membrane-type keyboards, and there's no sensory feedback with those at all. I'm so happy that keyboards like this are available for people like me who do a lot of typing and like to make a lot of noise (and be able to really feel each key) while we do it.

name: Aderyn
title: This is a very satisfactory keyboard
reviews: I am not a gamer, but my job requires me to use a keyboard almost nonstop, so I’m very picky about my keyboards.  I love having the clicky feedback, especially when I really get to rocking and rolling on the keys, so these blue switches are just right for me.  The keys engage with a very light touch, very kind to your fingers and hands, and the rollover function seems excellent; I have not managed to “out type” them yet, and I’m speedy.  I love the colorful backlighting, and it’s helpful since my workdays often stretch into the late night.  Keys can be lighted selectively, which seems as if it would be a nice advantage for gamers.  It has small retractable feet on the back edge so you can adjust the tilt to your preference.

name: Victoria
title: Good mechanical keyboard for the price!
reviews: My son was excited to test this out and see how it compared to the more expensive one he currently has.

name: Kristen B
title: Great after breaking in
reviews: So at first I thought I had a dude, and I could still have as when the keyboard came it was loose in the box and not packaged well.  The keys didn't work well at the start, had to " break" them in.  After a month of use though the keys work great and love that it has a 10-key.

name: Shaun H20
title: Very nice keyboard
reviews: This is a nice keyboard that I'm using for my laptop in the other room.  It's not as loud and "clicky" as my very expensive Corsair but overall it takes very little time to get used to. Also, the RGB makes it look really nice although you have limited control of the lighting effects of course unlike the Corsair (which uses iCue and can give you all sorts of crazy effects for your keyboard).  I'd definitely recommend this keyboard, it's a good value.

name: rareoopdvds
title: Keys are loud, but works well for gaming
reviews: This is a really nice keyboard, both functionally and aesthetically. The LED color patterns really make it standout as something "cool". While the lights do show up in mult-colors and they have some pattern to their changing colors, there is no way to manipulate the pattern - so you just let it do what it does. The key are loud and make the clicking noises with every press of the key, and as they are high from being spring loaded, they can sometimes make normal typing challenging. Besides this, I really like this keyboard and was a good price for what you get.

name: Zest
title: Good value
reviews: I personally collect a numerous of mechanical keyboards, such as "corsair K70", "ROCCAT Vulcan 120 AIMO", "Razer BlackWidow V3 Pro Mechanical Wireless Gaming Keyboard" with "Green Mechanical Switches". I also tested and reviewed many Chinese made, cheaper mechanical keyboard from Anker, Ajazz("Ajazz AK35I") , etc. So I had good expectation of what a good mechanical keyboard should offer. My son has the "Razer BlackWidow V3 Pro" as his daily keyboard, I drive my "ROCCAT Vulcan 120 AIMO" as my main keyboard.

name: Josh
title: Didn't Work For Me
reviews: The overall design and materials were not an issue for me, but every time I tried connecting it to my laptop (Chromebook) the mouse pointer would freeze in place on the screen and the mouse itself would stop responding (not even able to cycle through backlight colors). I tried this a few times by connecting to different USB ports and had the same issue each time. Ended up returning this one.

name: Ryann
title: Tilts slightly on hard surface. Constantly changing colors. Good for money.
reviews: Probably just me not reading close enough but the colors change constantly. You can not select one color and have it stay there. At first it was distracting for me but I got used to it after a few days. Mine slightly tilts when I click the left button but not at all noticeable when using a mousepad.  Also has plastic on the bottom so take that off for a smoother feel.

name: Tina M
title: This has got to be the worst mouse I've ever used
reviews: Let me tell you what's good about the mouse first.  It's a great length, it's comfortable to use, it's lightweight, it's inexpensive, and it does not feel cheap at all.

name: KATHY FRAGEMAN
title: LOVE IT
reviews: DID NOT REALIZE IT WAS A GAMING MOUSE.  BUT I LOVE IT & I BOUGHT IT FOR THE LONG CORD AS I AM 82 YRS OLD AND KEEP DROPPING THINGS.  I CAN PUT IT UP EASILY

name: Tammy
title: My son loves this light up mouse
reviews: My son uses this mouse every day. Holding up well. He loves that it lights up

name: Qtqbana
title: My son was very pleased!
reviews: This was bought for my son, so all the feedback is from his experiences. He asked for one with some feature buttons but not too many. He wanted it corded. He liked ones with alternating lights like his keyboard. He rated the accuracy at a 5/5 and comfort at 4/5. We arrived at the value for money together. 5/5.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Better than expected!
reviews: Got this for work.

name: Gary M. Carpenter
title: Great gaming mouse for the money.
reviews: A good little gaming mouse.  A tad smaller than my gaming Logitech mouse I had for years that fit my hand a little better,  but overall, it is comfortable and accurate.  Can't beat it for the price.

name: Luthien
title: Not worth it.
reviews: It changes colors automatically, kind of annoying sometimes.

name: Karmafan
title: Good Mouse For The Price.
reviews: It fits the hand sell and performs as advertised.

name: Psychic Cypher
title: Nice keyboard with some issues
reviews: I love this keyboard.

name: J. Campbell
title: A very nice gaming keyboard
reviews: Pros:

name: Bezoar
title: Satisfying, noisy, tactile feedback.
reviews: Disclaimer: I received this product for free through the Vine program.

name: Technology Guy
title: Nice clacky keyboard
reviews: I'm using this mostly for writing and coding. I really like the feel of the keys and they have improved my typing accuracy.

name: RW
title: Works great and excellent value
reviews: My son has 5 Mechanical keyboards as he loves them and was curious to compare this to the others that are in this price range and some more expensive such as the Ducky One 2 Mini.  He loves to change out the keys, see the colors and decide from several which ones he likes best.  He found this to be an excellent value.  It is full-sized, which if you need is not as common in gaming keyboards.  He switched out the key caps and found that easy to do.  The "Clickiness" he found to be addictive and enjoyed it almost as much as keyboards twice this price.

name: Steve Taylor
title: Great Budget Mechanical Keyboard
reviews: PROS:

name: Sharkattack99
title: Pretty good keyboard
reviews: Nice keyboard even made with metal parts which is a nice touch.

name: Benji
title: Meh
reviews: So first off, fully understand you get what you pay for. To potential buyers, spend the extra on a Red Dragon or something. This is very tingy after heavy use (work from home office, constant typing) and the space bar has started to stick due to one of the stabilizers being temperamental.

name: S R
title: Good blue keys keyboard that I love
reviews: If you don’t like full tactile feel, or a clicking sound is a distraction to you and/or others, this keyboard is not for you.

name: AE Gross
title: Nice click feel and great colors
reviews: This keyboard has a great feel and click to it and there is no problem with ghosting problems.  Games play nice and smooth. It has a nice click without be overly loud.  The keys are a blue equivalent  "clicky" (clicky = a bump in the middle of travel accompanied by a sharp “click” sound.) The colors are quite nice and fade just for a second when you press them - pretty cool. The volume control works smoothly and also looks pretty cool. I have been using this for a number of weeks and it's still working great.  Very happy with this keyboard.

name: Dino
title: Works perfectly so far.
reviews: Value for money.

title: Settings change
reviews: Every bootup the mouse forgets the dpi setting and resets. Movement is tight and drags more than slides across the mouse pad.

name: Francheska F.
title: Good Mouse
reviews: very good mouse, it is very comfortable and I am really surprised with the quality with respect to the price, I also really like the cable, very good purchase.

name: Br
title: Okay
reviews: It works as a temporary mouse untill u can get a really good one

name: Isaiah
title: Not best for people with large hands.
reviews: Good value for money imo just little small for me personally.

name: Weston
title: Glitchy and Unresponsive
reviews: Do not buy this mouse... For a few dollars more, there are many options out there that actually work. Liked the physical mouse, but it was insanity inducing that it constantly froze or was glitchy. I hadnt been so annoyed since dial up internet. First one was garbage. Second one worked for a few days, then started doing the same thing. Spent an hour trying all windows 10 troubleshoots for mouse issues. Not software, drivers, settings, etc. Just trash.  Almost gave another star for return and refund, which i appreciated, but i didnt want anyone to get stuck in the same situation as me by confusing it to be a 2 star item. You have been warned! lol

name: Amazon Customer
title: Good purchase.
reviews: It is for my son. He loves the shape of it and he loves the color changing lights around the mouse.

name: C. Simmons
title: Sleek and Smooth...
reviews: I love this mouse. It is sleek and soft to touch, and moves smoothly. Great item for the price point.

name: Brent Varner
title: Good mouse
reviews: Very good

name: diana gail hardy
title: Great acton mobility
reviews: Best gaming mouse I've ever had!

name: GardenCat
title: It's loud, but I love how easy and precise it is.  It's great for writers too
reviews: This is definitely a clicky click keyboard.  It's keys are easier to push than my old IBM and it's louder.

name: Sam Garcia
title: Mechanical Keyboard - Nice to have
reviews: I just plug in the mechanical keyboards and it just working perfectly. Very simple to use. It is very responsive when I type, click and press. When you click the "FIODIO" on the top right corner, you can switch the color setting. The only thing I want to get improve is the color on each key was stick to the same color that I can not change as it was build in the background.

name: VisualSol
title: Great keyboard
reviews: I've used with both mac and PC.  No issues.  Keys are brightly lit.  Pleasant typing experience.  Good price.  Would definitely recommend.

name: WSW
title: Perfect for me.
reviews: I like the click feel of the keys.  The color leds under the keys makes looking at the occasional pad easy in the dark.  You can control a couple different functions with the roller bar.  I like that the lights can go to sleep with your computer.

name: TastyPC
title: Cool keyboard for the price!
reviews: Overall, it's a great deal for $35. The keys don't change color, but it has some cool patterns.

name: tysonwalker jr
title: So far the best one that I have purchased
reviews: Great keyboard so far, I will update in time it breaks

name: Ken
title: Great Keyboard
reviews: I actually use the keyboard at work for everyday computer use.  Every one of my computers both at home or in the office have these keyboards.  Great feel when typing.

name: Joann
title: Great keyboard at a Great a price!
reviews: My kids love it and says it works great!

name: L. Catt
title: Love the lighted keyboard
reviews: Didn't buy this for gaming, but love the lights on it.  My keyboard is on a slide out tray under my desk and it's usually dark there.  I bought this so I would know what keys I am using.  Was tired of looking for the backspace, tab Delete, and print screen buttons.  This solved the problem beautifully.  Be aware that certain keys are a certain color and this can't be changed unless you pull a key and change the light.  This is something I don't care about, because I don't care about the colors.  It does flash a lot if you want it to.

name: R Stut
title: Basic affordable keyboard
reviews: A bit lacking in features, but keys lit well and feel good and responsive when pressed.  Ordered two of them, one arrived in good condition, the other smashed at one end.  After fishing out the pieces and reassembling it I bent the metal face back in to position, but it never went back together right because some of the screw bosses on the plastic foundation were destroyed.  In spite of this the keyboard continues to function.

name: Mariana
title: Great product
reviews: Very nice mouse. Works great and is comfortable. Love the colors as well. All buttons work great.

name: Tara Evans
title: Great performing
reviews: It is a very nice mouse it performs great and is good for any computer

name: Ander Examine
title: Meh
reviews: It’s an okay mouse. It’s weight in hand is overly light and so it’s not the best gamer mouse. The light gimmick is fine if you bought it for the shine but if you wanted function maybe search elsewhere.

name: jesse valdivia
title: Love the mouse!
reviews: Awesome mouse for the price! Works great. HAPPY! :)

name: N Montour
title: Not great
reviews: I have big hands and this kept getting recommended. It is a longer mouse but it is way to flat to be any good. I quickly returned it.

name: Vanessa S.
title: Cool lights and sleek design
reviews: Like the backlights so cool. Good value!

name: Hasan Mohammed
title: garbage responsivity
reviews: the mouse cant even track your movements properly. you can see the delay on your monitor while moving your mouse. this is a mass produced chinese export with the buzzword gamer slapped on top of it.

name: Victor Stott Jr.
title: Extremely Cheaply-Made
reviews: Don't buy this mouse. It started freezing up after about a week of using it. It keeps stopping and skipping as I move the mouse across the screen, and it takes a few tries for it to recognize clicks and scrolls on the scroll wheel. The old saying is true - you get what you pay for. Save your money and get something else instead.

name: Mr. Rusty
title: Design flaw needs to be corrected.
reviews: The mouse is a good mouse. It has all the right buttons in all the right places. It is the perfect shape for my hand.

name: Hemet user
title: hard to use
reviews: Its got this button the side that puts you back a screen that would be nice but to move the mouse a person has to push there and it makes for a lot of accidental backing

name: Charlie
title: Feels cheap
reviews: I guess you get what you pay for. The mouse works well enough but feels cheap and poorly made. The side buttons especially feel like they can break at any moment.

name: Mathew A. Shember
title: A simple inexpensive gaming mouse.
reviews: I admit I got this out of curiosity.  A layoff, covid lockdowns, and lost in a reshuffle.  I eventually found it again and gave it a try.

name: C. Woodward
title: Nice little mouse with a couple of annoying issues
reviews: Pros:

name: Dustin Farahnak
title: Dead simple, easy to use mouse
reviews: Compared to my nicest mouse, costing five times as much money, this mouse is actually better in a few ways.

name: TOPJOB7
title: Decent value gaming mouse
reviews: This is a basic gaming mouse adequate for most purposes. It has added weight which many gamers prefer (non-removable in this case) and I find it just slightly heavier than I'm used to but it's in the typical range. It has a rubberized type coating on the top but it isn't grabby. The sides are ribbed hard plastic. It is average size with a contoured shape that feels very comfortable in my hand. The cord is about 4 feet long and has a nice braided cover.

name: Tonja Drecker
title: Works well
reviews: Frustrated with a wireless mouse and the regular change of batteries, I decided to give this one a go. I'll admit, I'm not a gamer but do spend (thanks to work) a lot of time on the computer and wanted something easy to use, well fitting to the hand, and a little bit of fun. This mouse meets all of the above.

name: l2
title: smaller and lighter than most gaming mice, not programmable
reviews: This mouse is a little smaller and lighter weight than most gaming mice. It installed plug-and-play on my Windows 10 PC. It operates mostly smoothly and the DPI can be configured via buttons on the mouse. None of the buttons can be programmed like you can with name brand gaming mice. The lighting is cute at first, but gets annoying after a while. You can turn it off by pressing the two DPI buttons down at the same time. 3 stars for functionality + 1 star for value price = 4 stars.

name: Persnickety
title: Outstanding Value, Nice Wheel, Easy DPI switching
reviews: This is comparable to my razor mouse, not quite as good, but still very good. Especially given the very reasonable price.  I especially like the mouse wheel which is smooth and has good "dpi". (most mice in this range have a wheel where one click difference scrolls half a page)

name: CocoLoco
title: Decent mouse for the money
reviews: This computer mouse if really great for the price.  It looks and feels like similar computer mice that cost twice as much.  The lighting is very basic, it just fades in a continuous cycle but the lights look pretty cool even if they aren't super customizable.  Fast and accurate,  decent build quality.

name: Daniel Stark
title: ⭐A great entry level mouse⭐ 👇👇👇
reviews: This FIODIO gaming mouse definitely has customer niche to cater.

name: Auntie Annie
title: A  little trouble
reviews: I'm still having a little trouble adjusting to this. I will say that it is easier on the hands than the regular mouse, but my brain seems to have been wired by repetition. Of course, I guess that would be true for any mouse where the clicker is located on the side. No reflection on the quality of this product.

name: Alina
title: Works well and I love the Colors
reviews: For my use, this mouse works great! I should note that I am using this mouse for regular office use, not for gaming. I haven't had any issues with it so far. I have been using it every day while I work. I use it with my laptop so that I don't have to use the built-in touchpad. The scrolling wheel is convenient to use and the buttons react quickly when I press them. I especially like the rainbow colors, it brightens up my day!

name: Kate Estevez
title: As good as my last one
reviews: It’s very comfortable, the cable length is really good, the dpi is good and responsive. It looks nice and gets the job done. I’m happy with it. It works great for my level of gaming.

name: Meka270
title: Very nice
reviews: Very nice mouse

name: Elliot Knapp
title: Great mouse
reviews: I like this mouse a lot--while I'm not a huge gamer, I often do music production work that requires a good, ergonomic mouse, and I enjoy having a mouse set up with a variety of secondary button functions.  The mouse feels nice and solid (it doesn't have a lot of sharp edges, which some gaming mouses do and I'm not a fan of), the scroll wheel is smooth, I like the braided cloth cord, and the pulsing LEDs are cool (although I wish they had a better sleep mode or something, since it continues pulsing even when the mouse hasn't been in use for a while).  If you don't mind a wired mouse, this is a cost-effective and good option!

name: Gilbert M. Stack
title: Functional and Cool in One Package
reviews: This is a very cool gaming mouse. First off, its basic function of moving the pointer around was smooth and accurate—no problems at all. In addition, the buttons on the side of the mouse greatly sped up moving forward and backward through page links. But it’s the ability to change the color of the light radiating from the mouse that is my favorite part of the instrument. I realize that the light color has nothing to do with the actual functionality, but it was just cool and I love it.

name: Douglas C. Meeks
title: A Great Gaming Mouse
reviews: This has it all, comfort for hours of play, responsive so no lag when it counts the most and add in plug and play (many gaming mice require additional software) plus looking really cool and you have a 5 Star device.

name: Kim S
title: Fits well for both people of the house, 1 female, 1 male
reviews: The fiodio F-9520 Gaming Mouse has a nice slim ergonomic feel that's easy to use with a clean and elegant design. The matte black finish also shows oils after some use, but it's only visible when looking closely.

name: B Frazier
title: Cool... comfortable mouse
reviews: I always get the wireless mouse and having to keep replacing the battery in them, so this time I decided to try a wired one. I’m so glad I did. This mouse is so vibrant and colorful when in use. It’s very comfortable and it’s cars is long enough to reach from the back of my pc to the top of my desk and have wiggle room. It’s a gaming mouse and it does move with all the action. Great price and quality.

name: Chris F.
title: Good mouse for the price
reviews: While I have not yet used this mouse for heavy gaming, light use has shown it to be very responsive and comfortable in my hand. The buttons respond well and the wheel spins as expected. I have been very happy with this thus far.

name: Nuk
title: Not so precise
reviews: I needed a quick replacement mouse because one of the buttons of the one I am using gave up.  If you are used to a nice more expensive mouse, the initial feel is that it is very basic and cheap.  My main problem is precision.  It should be OK as a multi-purpose mouse but felt underwhelming if you can call it a gaming mouse.

name: Ernesto
title: It is still lasting
reviews: The FIODIO Wired Gaming Mouse works very well for my laptop and haven't had any disconnecting issues of any kind. It feels comfortable when moving it around and clicking on items. I do not do have gaming, but it works well with the digital board games and playing Among Us. It is a good gaming mouse for the price.

name: Troy Betenson
title: Great value
reviews: Easy to use and fits the hand great. Plug and play. Quick sensitivity adjustments on the top and back and forward browser buttons on the thumb side. Smooth roller button as well. Great value

name: crazy_shopper
title: Very Nice and handy wired mouse
reviews: I have brought this for my windows 10 PC. This mouse works fine and very hand it use. Just plug in and Use, i haven't installed any additional software to make it work.

name: Melissa Dumas
title: Great mouse!
reviews: This mouse is pretty awesome! The colors are vibrant and fun, quality feels good and it does its job. Definitely recommend.

name: Curtis
title: nice!
reviews: great mouse. not to small or big has plenty of buttons and moves very smooth

name: Jesus O. martinez
title: Great mouse
reviews: No complaints works great and is very presise..

name: dustin stover
title: It works like crap
reviews: Its prob the worst mouse ive ever had

name: Debora B
title: Comfortable and light
reviews: Comfortable to use and very accurate. Great value for the money.

name: Sam Tahsin
title: Amazing for the price
reviews: Works well, cool LED, has gaming qualities

name: MoistUnCritical
title: Worked for a few months
reviews: Its not worth it for the few months it lasted.

name: Diego Rodríguez Reyna
reviews: Es un excelente producto, en este caso se usa para algo cotidiano y excede las expectativas por el cual se comrpó pero estuvo genial la compra.

name: veronica r.
reviews: es útil y práctico

name: Pablo
reviews: Realmente estoy sorprendido. Creo que este Mouse es excelente, me gustó mucho. Sí se siente gamer, sí se ve bonito, funciona muy bien. A mí parecer es de lo mejor que he comprado en relación calidad-precio. Yo sí lo recomiendo.

name: Vincent M.
reviews: Good product but it stopped working after 2 weeks.

name: Vincelette
reviews: At 144Hz, the mouse jitters.

name: Anthony Ference
reviews: It works great

name: Daniel-Jacques Usain
reviews: Rapport qualité prix incroyable. Vraiment une bonne souris pour le prix

name: Renee Therrien
reviews: J'aime bien la forme elle tiens bien dans la main et les lumières ne font que la rendre plus belle ;-)

name: Justin
reviews: Es muy comodo y suave, esta genial lo de las luces que indican el dpi y sobre todo es efectivo para los juegos fps (first person shooter) y es ligero
